name: Kansas City Burnt End Sandwich
author: Reynolds Kitchens(R)
summary: Get your grill and palate ready to taste the ultimate in BBQ with this Kansas City Burnt End Sandwich recipe.
ingredients: 1  point from whole smoked brisket, cut into 1-inch squares
Reynolds Wrap® Heavy Duty Aluminum Foil
directions: Form two 2-foot pieces of Reynolds® Heavy Duty Aluminum Foil into large bowl-like shapes with 2-inch high sides; place on the grill
Add the point pieces from the brisket to the foil bowl along with the beef broth and BBQ sauce and mix until combined
Cook the point pieces for 30 minutes on medium heat with the grill door closed or until they appear to be caramelizing and deeply browned, almost as if they were burnt
Serve the BBQ burnt ends on hamburger buns
